experience_requirements: 4+ years hands-on experience developing and deploying computer vision models
Experience with image classification, segmentation, and object detection
Experience building production image data pipelines (acquisition -> annotation -> training -> deployment)
Experience with Python and deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow)
Experience with image preprocessing techniques and digital image processing
Experience collaborating with software, QA, and hardware teams
key_responsibilities: Design, train and deploy deep learning models (CNNs) for fine-grained visual inspection and defect detection
Apply advanced image analysis techniques (segmentation, feature extraction, contrast enhancement)
Build cosmetic grading models to classify surface conditions and assign quality grades
Develop techniques to address inconsistent human annotations (label smoothing, uncertainty quantification, consensus modeling, HITL)
Architect and manage end-to-end image data pipelines
Integrate models into production workflows with software/QA/hardware teams
Collaborate cross-functionally to meet product and production requirements
education_requirements: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, EE, or related quantitative field (or equivalent experience)
Advanced coursework or certifications in Machine Learning / Computer Vision recommended (e.g., specialized courses, diplomas)
Relevant continuous education (deep learning, data science) is beneficial
nice_to_have: Direct experience in cosmetic or surface defect grading applications
Experience with high-resolution imaging and microscopy-level inspection
Experience with uncertainty quantification and consensus modeling
Prior work in manufacturing/visual inspection or logistics at scale

location_requirements.location: Not specified in posting (Factored is Palo Alto-founded; role may be global/LatAm friendly)

industry_knowledge: Satellite remote sensing (experience present in resume)
Agriculture (crop detection) and other applied CV domains
key_projects: Develop production-grade visual inspection systems for automated cosmetic grading
Create and deploy classification and segmentation models for defect detection
Build and maintain image data pipelines from acquisition through annotation to deployment
Implement human annotation quality methods: label smoothing, consensus, uncertainty estimation, HITL tools
Integrate CV models into production with software, QA and hardware teams; edge deployment for factory floor
career_growth: Opportunities for professional growth and learning
Potential to lead AI initiatives and hire/train others
training_provided: Support for professional development and courses
diversity_inclusion: Company emphasizes global talent and merit-based growth; encourages diverse backgrounds and inclusive culture.

skill_details.skill_name: Uncertainty quantification / label smoothing / consensus / HITL

strengths: Strong hands-on production experience deploying CV systems (led end-to-end production-control system)
High proficiency in core tech: Python, PyTorch/TensorFlow, OpenCV, object detection
Demonstrated ability to build and operate image data pipelines and edge deployments
Excellent communication and cross-functional leadership (presentations, product ownership)
Solid DevOps and cloud familiarity (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS) enabling production integration
gaps: Limited explicit experience in cosmetic-specific grading of high-resolution surface images (cosmetics/consumer device surface grading)
Less explicit documented experience with dedicated uncertainty quantification / consensus-modeling pipelines
No explicit industry certifications specific to visual inspection or metrology
Limited explicit mention of dealing with subjective labeling at scale for cosmetic standards

score_explanation: Overall match = 80.85% (weighted combination of components). Candidate shows strong technical and production CV experience but has some gaps in domain-specific cosmetic grading expertise.

Technical skills (0.7316 / 1.0) are strong: candidate has real-world deployments, object detection/segmentation projects, and experience with core frameworks and cloud. This yields 25.6 out of 35 possible technical points.

Soft skills scored highly (0.9 / 1.0) because the resume demonstrates product ownership, team leadership, excellent English proficiency, and frequent stakeholder presentations — contributing 18 out of 20 points.

Experience match (0.85 / 1.0) is high due to 3+ years leading production CV projects plus earlier CV work (total ~4+ years). Relevant production, pipeline and edge experience contributes 21.25 out of 25 points.
Education (0.9 / 1.0): candidate has an engineering degree plus a data science diploma and ongoing Stanford ML coursework — strong educational fit contributing 9 out of 10 points.

Industry match (0.7 / 1.0): candidate has industrial visual inspection and production control experience (positive), but less explicit history in cosmetic grading of high-resolution consumer device surfaces (so domain-specific score lowered), contributing 7 out of 10 points.
Key strengths include production deployments, broad tooling knowledge, cross-functional delivery, and strong communication.

Key gaps to address in interview or via sample work: direct cosmetic/consumer-device surface grading examples, experience handling subjective cosmetic labels at scale (consensus/HITL/uncertainty), and examples with very high-resolution image handling if required.

Recommendation: Candidate is a strong match and should be advanced to technical interview and a take-home or system-design exercise focused on cosmetic defect detection and label-noise handling to validate domain-specific capabilities.
